module.title: Site Layout
module.desc: Select the site layout you want to display.

module.title: Show Top Bar
module.desc: Turn on to show a 30 pixels top bar that in turn show your social media profile icons.

module.title: Back to Top Link
module.desc: Turn on to show a back to top link/button when a page is scrolled down a certain percentage. It takes the user back to the top of the page when clicked.

module.title: Show Breadcrumbs
module.desc: Turn on to show breadcrumbs on pages.

module.title: Navigation Scroll Follow
module.desc: Turn on to enable the navigation section to always be visible on the screen even when scrolling down the page.

module.title: Top nav left content
module.desc: Enter any text to show in top nav left side

module.title: Show Phone Number
module.desc: Turn on show your contact phone in the footer bar. This is mobile friendly as mobile users can tap the phone number and would automatically dialed it.

module.title: Phone Number
module.desc: Enter your contact phone number.

module.title: Display Search
module.desc: Turn on to display search icon and field.

module.title: Search Context
module.desc: Select the items you would like to search for when users types into the search fields. Setting it to all will search everything on the site but be warned that this is not always recommended as it may break the styling. And smart-search will search for products when in product context and search for blog posts when in blog context.

module.title: Display Update Notification
module.desc: Turn on to show the system theme and framework update notification.

module.title: Install Sample Data
module.desc: Click on the button to install sample data to your site. This is recommended to be used on a fresh installed site with no content.

module.title: Mobile Zooming
module.desc: Turn on to enable zooming capabilities on mobile devices (default is ON). Turning this off will fix the issue of when the device is rotated, the site is initially zoomed in effect. When off, it will also prevent users from pinch to zoom.

module.title: Hide Left Right Sidebars in Small Mobile Devices
module.desc: Turn on to hide sidebars on small mobile devices that have a resolution less than 768 pixels.

module.title: Hide Footer Sidebars/Widgets in Small Mobile Devices
module.desc: Turn on to hide footer sidebars on small mobile devices that have a resolution less than 768 pixels.

module.title: Hide Sliders in Small Mobile Devices
module.desc: Turn on to hide all sliders on small mobile devices such as mobile phones to give better performance and userability.

module.title: Enable Sitewide Sidebars
module.desc: Turn on to enable sitewide sidebars left and right to be available for widgets. This is a global setting. You may override this per page/post.

wrapper.title: Sidebar Layout on Product Category and Product Archive Pages

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the sidebar layout settings for product category and product archive pages.

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display.

wrapper.title: Sidebar Layout on Product Single Detail Page

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the sidebar layout settings for a single product detail page.

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display. We recommend no sidebars for this page.

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the sidebar layout settings for your blog category pages. You can always override this setting per page level giving you even finer control.

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display.

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the sidebar layout settings for your page. You can always override this setting per page level giving you even finer control.

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display.

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the sidebar layout settings for your portfolio page. You can always override this setting per page level giving you even finer control.

module.title: Sidebar Orientation
module.desc: Select the sidebar orientation you want to display.

module.title: Show Related Posts
module.desc: Turn on to display related posts in the single post page

module.title: Custom Text
module.desc: Enter the custom title text you would like to show for the Related Post section. (default Related Posts)

module.title: Select Pagination Style
module.desc: Select the type of pagination style you want for your blog posts. One is paginated by numeration and the other is by next and previous post or posts. You can also turn all pagination off. (default is numeration)

module.title: Show Social Media Profile Icons
module.desc: Turn on to show social media profile icons on the top bar.

module.title: Enable RSS Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show the RSS icon and will be link to the feeds.

module.title: RSS Feed URL
module.desc: (Optional) Enter the RSS feed URL if you're not using the WordPress standard feeds. (i.e. Google Feed Burner). This will redirect your feed URL site wide to the one you have set.

module.title: Enable Google Plus Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show your Google Plus icon on the site which will link to your Google profile set below.

module.title: Google Plus Profile URL
module.desc: Enter your Google Plus Profile URL (i.e http://plus.google.com/115445554083854323481).

module.title: Enable Facebook Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show your Facebook icon on the site which will link to your Facebook profile set below.

module.title: Facebook Account
module.desc: Enter your Facebook account name (i.e. http://facebook.com/splashingpixels).

module.title: Twitter
module.desc: Turn on to show your Twitter icon on the site which will link to your Twitter profile set below.

module.title: Twitter Account
module.desc: Enter your Twitter account name (i.e. http://twitter.com/splashingpixels)..

module.title: Pinterest Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show your Pininterest icon on the site which will link to your Pinterest profile set below.

module.title: Pinterest Profile Name
module.desc: Enter your Pinterest Profile URL (i.e http://pinterest.com/splashingpixels/).

module.title: Flickr Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show your Flickr icon on the site which will link to your Flickr profile set below.

module.title: Flickr Account
module.desc: Enter your Flickr account name (i.e. http://flickr.com/photos/splashingpixels).

module.title: YouTube Icon
module.desc: Turn on to show your Youtube icon on the site which will link to your Youtube profile set below.

module.title: YouTube Profile Name
module.desc: Enter your YouTube Profile URL (i.e http://youtube.com/user/splashingpixels/).

module.title: Facebook Open Graph
module.desc: Turn on to enable Facebook Open Graph feature where if someone clicks on your LIKE button, your page information - including the image will be displayed on their Facebook page. This is used to further improve your social marketing outreach.

module.title: App ID
module.desc: Enter the ID of the app

module.title: Admin ID
module.desc: Enter the ID of the admin for the Facebook page

module.title: Footer Widget Area
module.desc: Select how many columns you want to display for your footer widget area. This area is usually in the footer area above the copyright footer.

module.title: widget settings.
module.desc: You can add custom widget areas to a specific page. This will allow you to have different widgets depending on the page you're on. Once you have generated all the widgets, you will see new widget areas in the
Please note that this only applies to pages with default editor and does not work with Advanced Page Builder. You can create your own widget areas on the page when using Advanced Page Builder.

module.title: Create Widgets for Page
module.desc: Select the page you want to create custom widgets for.

module.title: widget settings.
module.desc: You can add custom widget areas to a specific blog category. This will allow you to have different widgets depending on the blog category you're on. Once you have generated all the widgets, you will see new widget areas in the

module.title: Create Widgets for Blog Category
module.desc: Select the blog category you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: widget settings.
module.desc: You can add custom widget areas to a specific product category. This will allow you to have different widgets depending on the product category you're on. Once you have generated all the widgets, you will see new widget areas in the

module.title: Create Widgets for Product Category
module.desc: Select the product category you want to create custom widgets for

module.title: Backend Admin Logo
module.desc: Upload a logo you want to display on top of the login form. The recommended size of the logo should not exceed 323x67 pixels.

module.title: Background Image
module.desc: You can customize the background style by selecting from our predefined background images or uploading your own background image.

module.title: Image Position
module.desc: Choose the position you want your image to start with (i.e. if you choose left, your image will start from the very left edge).
module.option: left top,left center,left bottom,right top,right center,right bottom,center top,center center,center bottom

module.title: Image Repeat
module.desc: Choose how you want your image to be repeated if using a repeatable tile image. (i.e. if you choose repeat-x, this will repeat your image left to right).

module.title: Background Attachment
module.desc: Select the effect you want your image to have whether it scrolls with the page or fixed in place

module.title: Background Color
module.desc: Choose a background color for your site. This color compliments the background design you chose if the design is semi-opaque, this background color setting will show through or if your background design does not fill the screen, this background color will fill the rest.

module.title: Link Text Color
module.desc: Pick a color for your link text. This is usually used to provide contrast between the background and text.

module.title: Link Text Color on Hover
module.desc: Pick a color for your link text on hover.

module.title: Show Login Link
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of the login link.

module.title: Login Page
module.desc: Select the page you want as your login page. After you have selected the page, put the login shortcode on that page to display the login form.

module.title: Show Register/Signup Link
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of the register/signup link. Please note that show login needs to be on for this setting to show.

module.title: Register Page
module.desc: Select the page you want as your register page. After you have selected the page, put the register shortcode on that page to display the register form.

module.title: Show Names
module.desc: Select the name type you would like the hello message to display once a user is logged in.

module.title: Paste Code
module.desc: Paste the Google Analytics code provided to you in your Google Analytics account. ( please do not include the opening and ending script tags as it has been added for you )

module.title: Info
module.desc: This is the general SEO settings for your site and is used as a fallback when you don't have specific settings for a page. To set SEO for a specific page, please refer to that page's settings.

module.title: Enable SEO
module.desc: Turning this on will enable SEO for your site. If you're using 3rd party SEO plugins, you can choose to turn this off.

module.title: Meta Description
module.desc: (Maximum 160 Characters) Enter the description you want search engines to see for your site.

module.title: Meta Keywords
module.desc: (Comma separated list) Enter each keyword separated by a comma so the search engines will pick up.

module.title: Header Custom Script Code
module.desc: Enter your custom JS script here to be loaded in your head section. (Do not include the script tags as they are already added for you)

module.title: Footer Custom Script Code
module.desc: Enter your custom JS script here to be loaded in your footer section. (Do not include the script tags as they are already added for you)
Add your own custom CSS styles here. If you prefer to work in your own text editor, you can always modify the file user-styles.css in your theme folder. If one does not exist, you can create it.

module.title: Maintenance Page
module.desc: Click the button to create the page necessary to display the maintenance page.

module.title: Enable Maintenance Mode
module.desc: Check the box to enable maintenance mode.

module.title: Redirect to Page or URL
module.desc: Select if you want visitors to be redirected to the custom maintenance page on your site or to a specified external URL.

module.title: External URL
module.desc: Enter the external URL in which you want your visitors to be redirected to. (if URL is selected up above)

module.title: Allowed IP Addresses
module.desc: Enter a list of IP addresses in which you want to allow access during the maintenance mode. Enter one IP per line.

module.title: Select Design
module.desc: You can choose to use the theme default design for the maintenance page or you can custom design your own maintenance page.

module.title: Custom Page
module.desc: You can custom design your own maintenance page here.

module.title: Show Logo
module.desc: Turn on to enable logo display.

module.title: Title Text
module.desc: Enter the title text you want to display. For example Maintenance In Progress.

module.title: Display Countdown
module.desc: Turn on to enable the countdown timer display.

module.title: UTC Timezone Offset
module.desc: Enter the UTC timezone offset you wish to use. For example in Pacific Standard Time, it would be -7 with daylight savings time. (You can find out yours by going to http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/difference.html)

module.title: Ending Maintenance Date Time
module.desc: Enter the date and time your maintenance will end.

module.title: Enable Twitter Button
module.desc: Turn on to enable Twitter follow button.

module.title: Twitter Account
module.desc: Enter your Twitter account URL (i.e. http://twitter.com/splashingpixels)..

module.title: Email Notification
module.desc: Turning this on will display an email input field for visitors who wants to be kept up to date with the status of the site. An email will be sent to the admin's email address.
You can save different configuration settings that you like and reapply them later. This will let you easily test different settings without losing anything.

Alternatively to saving your configurations, you can export the entire theme settings to a file for safe keeping. This can be used when you're switching host or wanting to start the database from scratch but want to retain your theme settings.

module.title: Export Settings
module.desc: Copy and paste the code you see in the box into any plain text file and store it in a safe place. You can use Notepad if you're on Windows or TextEdit if you're on Mac.

module.title: Import Settings
module.desc: Paste the code you had previously saved into the box and click on import.

module.title: Reset Customized Settings
module.desc: This will reset all customizations done via the theme customizer to their default values.

module.title: Reset Config Settings Cache
module.desc: This will reset the config setting's cache and pull in new changes to the theme config file.

module.title: Reset All Theme Settings
module.desc: This will reset all theme options to their default values.

module.title: System Status
module.desc: Here are a list of current status of your site.

module.title: Product Wishlist Page
module.desc: Select the page you want as your wishlist page. Please note that the page you select must use the page template of Product Wishlist for the display to work. Simply go to your page and in the right hand sidebar, select the page template.

module.title: Show Wishlist Icon
module.desc: Turning this on will show the product wishlist icon in the header area and will allow visitors to click on and be redirected to the wishlist page.

module.title: Product Compare Page
module.desc: Select the page you want as your compare page. Please note that the page you select must use the page template of Product Compare for the display to work. Simply go to your page and in the right hand sidebar, select the page template.

module.title: Show Compare Icon
module.desc: Turning this on will show the product compare icon in the header area and will allow visitors to click on and be redirected to the compare page.

module.title: Show Breadcrumbs
module.desc: Turn on to show breadcrumbs on product category pages.

module.title: Products Per Row
module.desc: Enter how many products you would like to display per row. This is used on product category pages.

module.title: Products Per Page
module.desc: Enter how many products per page to display. This is used on product category pages.

module.title: Show Product Ordering
module.desc: Turn on to show a dropdown for product ordering/sorting.

module.title: Show Mini Shopping Cart
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of the mini cart in the header section.

module.title: Cart Type
module.desc: Select the mini cart type you would like displayed. Simple - shows only the number of items and the sub-total and whereas Full - shows the product details such as the name and image along with the sub-total and number of items.

module.title: Show Product Image Gallery
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of multiple product gallery images under the main product image.

module.title: Product Gallery Image Swap
module.desc: Turn on to enable product gallery image swap. When on, clicking on the product gallery thumbnail image will swap the main image with the one clicked. When off, clicking on a gallery image will open a lightbox. (default is ON)

module.title: Product Image Gallery Slider
module.desc: Turn on to display your product gallery in a slider instead of a grid of images.

module.title: Product Image Zoom
module.desc: Turn on to display an enlarged / zoomed in version of your product image when mouse is hovered over it.

module.title: Product Quickview
module.desc: Check box to enable SP Quickview System.

module.title: Product Quickview Image Width
module.desc: Set the width you would like for your image inside the quickview box. This affects the size when image is in single column only. We recommend not to exceed 400 pixels as it will have impact on performance on mobile devices.

module.title: Product Quickview Image Height
module.desc: Set the height you would like for your image inside the quickview box. This affects the size when image is in single column only. If your image is being cropped off too early, you can set unlimited height with 9999 pixels. Or you can try turning OFF cropping on the setting below.

module.title: Product Quickview Image Crop
module.desc: Set the image crop settings. Turn on to perform a hard crop on the image where it will crop the image as close to your width and height settings above as possible. Leave it off for a soft crop where it will crop it to the propotion of your image.

module.title: Enable Product Grid/List View Buttons
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of product views where users can click between grid or list view. This is displayed on the product category pages.

module.title: Default Product View
module.desc: Set the default product view when a visitor first visits your site.

module.title: Enable Product Sale Badge
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of sale badge for your products.

module.title: Enable Product New Badge
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of new badge for your products.

module.title: New Badge
module.desc: This sets how long to display the new badge. For example if you enter 10, that means the new badge will show for 10 days after the date of when it was created.

module.title: Show Add to Cart on Hover
module.desc: Turning this on will show the add to cart button only when mouse to hovered on the product. This is for product category view. If off, the add to cart button will always be visible under the product.

module.title: Show Social Share Icons
module.desc: Turning this on will show social share icons for your products. This affects single product page only.

wrapper.title: Related, Up Sale and Cross Sale Products

module.title: Show Related Products
module.desc: Turn on to show related products section.

module.title: Set Number of Related Products to Display
module.desc: Enter the number of related products you want to display on the single products page

module.title: Related Product Heading Text
module.desc: Type the title you want to appear for your related product section

module.title: Show Upsell Products
module.desc: Turn on to show upsell products section.

module.title: Set Number of Upsell Products to Display
module.desc: Enter the number of upsell products you want to display on the single products page

module.title: Upsell Product Heading Text
module.desc: Type the title you want to appear for your upsell product section

module.title: Show Cross Sell Products
module.desc: Turn on to show cross sell products section in the cart.

module.title: Set Number of Cross Sell Products to Display
module.desc: Enter the number of cross sell products you want to display on the cart page

module.title: Cross Sell Product Heading Text
module.desc: Type the title you want to appear for your cross sell product section

module.title: Show Product Ratings
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of product rating stars per product. Note that this is not related to comment review form or function.

module.title: Enable Login on Checkout
module.desc: Turn on to enable sign up/login on checkout.

module.title: Enable 3 Step Checkout
module.desc: Turn on to enable 3 step checkout flow. Note that some WooCommerce plugins are not compatible with this style of checkout. If so, you may want to turn this off.

module.title: Info
module.desc: This section allows you to add additional information on the checkout pages to help customers when in need. For example you can add a contact phone number incase customers have questions on the checkout page or encounter an error. Or you can add popup links like FAQs, Privacy Policy, contact email, shipping information, returns & exchanges...etc.

module.title: Show Additional Information
module.desc: Turn on to enable the display of additional information section on checkout pages. If off, all items set below will not show.

module.title: Text Info
module.desc: Enter a line of text that will help customers if they need assistance in the checkout process. For example, you can enter ( Need help? Contact us for further assistance. 888.888.8888 ).
module.std: Need Help? Contact us for further assistance. 888.888.8888

module.title: Add Popup Link
module.desc: You can add your popup links here.

module.title: Show Checkout Breadcrumbs
module.desc: Turning this on will show a breadcrumb indicating each step of the checkout process to the customers to better the usability.

module.title: Info
module.desc: The following setting will place a SSL Seal in your checkout pages to further assure your customers that it is safe to shop in your store. Please note that this is not to substitute a real SSL certificate.

module.title: Upload SSL Image
module.desc: Upload the SSL image provided by your SSL provider. Or you can paste the script below.

module.title: SSL Code
module.desc: Paste the script code provided by your SSL provider to display the secured image/icon. Take note that this will take precedence over the uploaded SSL image.

module.title: Help! Every page is going to page not found!
module.answer: Go to WordPress settings->permalinks and click on save TWICE.

module.title: How do I update the theme and framework?
module.answer: Go to your Splashing Pixels member dashboard by logging in. Download the latest version of your theme. Be sure to backup your existing site files and database prior to updating. It is also best practice to update it on a test/staging server prior to your live site. Unzip the newly downloaded zip file which now you should see your theme folder. Within this folder consists of the framework as well. Using a FTP program login to your site via FTP. Put the contents of the theme folder to your current site's theme folder. So the path should like similar to this /public_html/wp-content/themes/yourtheme/.

module.title: How do I customize the CSS without it being overwritten on updates?
module.answer: There are two ways you can modify the CSS. First way is to go to your theme settings->general settings tab->custom css styles. The second way is to create a file called user-styles.css and place this file inside the theme folder root level. The theme will know to look into this file for any styles you may wish to add or change.

module.title: My theme settings does not seem to be saving!
module.answer: First check that when you click on the SAVE button, you see the spinning logo and a checkmark indicating your changes have been saved. If you do see the spinning logo and checkmark but it still doesn't save, check if you have other conflicting plugins by deactivating one by one to see which one is the culprit. If you do not see the checkmark but instead see the no can do sign, then try logging out and logging back in as this will flush your authentication.

module.title: Emails are not being received when using the built in contact form
module.answer: First check that WordPress itself is able to send emails by creating a temporary bogus account and checking the box that sends the password to the bogus account. Make sure you put a valid email address. If you do not receive anything from WordPress, it could mean your server is not allowing you to use mail() function. In those cases you would need a third party plugin so that you can use SMTP mail protocol instead. Here is a community recommended plugin you can try http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-mail-smtp/.

module.title: Theme customizer preview window is acting up!
module.answer: If you have tabs displayed in the preview, this can happen and it is a bug in WordPress. This bug has already been reported and you can track the ticket here -> http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/24032. Meanwhile to overcome this issue, simply disable any tabs on that page temoprarily while you're using the customizer.

module.title: Help! I am getting Fatal error: Maximum execution time of 30 seconds exceeded in /MY_SITE_PATH/wp-includes/class-wp-image-editor-imagick.php
module.answer: This error is usually due to the image sizes being too large. To remedy this issue, please try to keep each image you upload no more than 300k. You can do this by optimizing your images for the WEB. Most graphic programs have this function such as Photoshop.

module.title: None of my footer widgets are showing!
module.answer: Make sure you have enable sitewide sidebars in your theme settings->sidebar layouts.

module.title: Tagline is not updating or turning on in live preview in customizer
module.answer: After you have clicked to turn on, save the settings first and on the next page refresh it will show up and you can then start to customize it.

module.title: Quickview popup box keeps closing when I am trying to customize it in the theme customizer.
module.answer: Unfortunately there is no work around for this as the quickview popup was designed to go away when mouse clicks outside of the popup box. However any changes you make in the customizer will still take affect.
